themes.label: Decrees
themes.rationale: The text is a formal decree of the Athenian Council and People, as indicated by the mention of 'psephismata' and the standard procedural language regarding the Council and the People.
themes.quote: κατὰ ψηφίσματα τῆς βουλῆς καὶ τοῦ δήμου

themes.label: Honorific Inscriptions
themes.rationale: The inscription honors specific officials (the grain commissioners) with a golden crown for their justice and ambition in office.
themes.quote: στεφανῶσαι αὐτοὺς χρυσῶι στεφάνωι κατὰ τὸν νόμον φιλοτιμίας ἕνεκα καὶ δικαιοσύνης

themes.label: Lists of Officials or Citizens
themes.rationale: The decree includes a list of the grain commissioners (sitophylakes) and their secretary, identified by their names and demotics.
themes.quote: τοὺς σιτοφύλακας τοὺς ἐπὶ Ἀθηνοδώρου ἄρχοντος ... Ἀρχίαν Ἀρχῖνον Χαρνίαν Ἀγάθαρχον ... Εὔδημον Μελιτέα καὶ τὸν κληρωτὸν γραμματέα Ἐργοκλῆν Κρωπίδην

themes.label: Stele
themes.rationale: The text explicitly orders the recording of the decree on a stone stele.
themes.quote: ἀναγράψαι δὲ τόδε τὸ ψήφισμα τὸν γραμματέα τὸν κατὰ πρυτανείαν ἐν στήλει λιθίνει

rationale: This is an Athenian honorific decree from the mid-3rd century BCE. It honors the 'sitophylakes' (grain commissioners) who served during the archonship of Athenodorus. The text follows the standard Athenian formula for such decrees: it mentions the Council and People, lists the names and demotics of the officials being honored, specifies the award of a golden crown for their 'philotimia' (ambition/love of honor) and 'dikaiosyne' (justice), and provides instructions for the publication of the decree on a stone stele. The military treasurer is tasked with paying for the inscription. Notably, King Antigonus (likely Antigonus II Gonatas) is also mentioned in the latter part of the fragment.
